snippet: About 3,000 to 5,000 Arab fighters are to join more than 20,000 Kurdish combatants in an offensive backed by dozens of allied warplanes to pressure Raqqa, the Islamic State’s main stronghold in Syria.
abstract: Obama administration and United States military officials say US-led coalition battling Islamic State is preparing new assault on group in northeastern Syrian city of Raqqa, which has become group's de facto capital; plan is meant to empower 3,000 to 5,000 Arab fighters by giving them weapons and ammunition so that they can join over 20,000 Kurdish fighters already pressuring city.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL R. GORDON

lead_paragraph: About 3,000 to 5,000 Arab fighters are to join more than 20,000 Kurdish combatants in an offensive backed by dozens of allied warplanes to pressure Raqqa, the Islamic State’s main stronghold in Syria.

headline.main: U.S. Aims to Put More Pressure on ISIS in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. Aims to Put More Pressure on ISIS in Syria
